title: KSI vs Logan Paul UK press conference tickets sold out as fight edges closer
text:

Tickets for the London press conference for KSI's rematch with Logan Paul have sold out, according to promoter Eddie Hearn.

The YouTube stars will clash for a second time at the Staples Center in Los Angeles on November 9 after fighting to a draw in Manchester last year.

Both KSI and Paul have turned professional for their second fight, with the pair granted professional licences by the California State Athletic Commission.

As anticipation for next month's contest continues to grow, the pair will face the media and fans in London at music venue Troxy at 6pm on Monday, October 7.

Following their appearance in LA last month, it appears that UK fans wasted no time in securing their tickets for the UK event.

(Image: Getty Images)

In a post to his official Instagram page on Saturday, Hearn wrote : "We are out of tickets for the KSI v Logan Paul UK press conference - 3,000 of them went immediately online.

"Monday will be double lively."

While fans will be able to watch the press conference on Youtube and across Matchroom Boxing's social channels, the fight itself will be broadcast on subscription service DAZN in the US while Hearn has indicated that UK fans will be able to watch the bout for £9.99 on Sky Sports Box Office.

The first meeting between the pair, which ended in a controversial draw, generated significant interest in both the UK and US, amassing over 1.3 million pay-per-view buys.

The second installment of the rivalry will include undercard appearances by super-middleweight world champion Billy Joe Saunders and rising star Devin Haney.

Hearn has previously admitted that the first press conference in LA took him by surprise.

"I have to be honest, I was stood in the press conference thinking ‘What the f*** is going on here?’" he told the Sportsman last month .

"Then I looked at the numbers and I saw that 700,000 people were watching the press conference live on their channels. I think now 10million people have watched the press conference.

"So what’s the global audience for this fight going to be? I don’t know, in excess of 50 million?

(Image: Alex Burstow/Getty Images)

"If we can retain one per cent to the sport, then that’s massive for the sport, but we’ve got to work hard to do that. It’s not going to be easy, I’d like to retain 10 per cent.

"If we can showcase why we love the sport, Devin Haney, Billy Joe Saunders and show this new audience how great the sport is, then we’ve got a chance.

"We can’t ignore this new world that we live in. Olympic athletes are no longer role models for the younger generation, Youtube stars are. As sad as it may seem, that’s the truth, that’s the world we live in.

"We just need to face reality, embrace it and try and use that to keep growing boxing."
description: The YouTube stars will face the media and fans in London on October 7 ahead of their rematch next month
